intro: Pilosella vegaradana, commonly known as the Alpine hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy foliage and small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its fibrous root system helps it stabilize soil in harsh mountain environments.
